metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23942 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Nextcloud Desktop Client is a tool to synchronize files from a Nextcloud Server with your computer. Versions prior to 3.6.3 are missing sanitisation on qml labels which are used for basic HTML elements such as `strong`, `em` and `head` lines in the UI of the desktop client. The lack of sanitisation may allow for javascript injection. It is recommended that the Nextcloud Desktop Client is upgraded to 3.6.3. There are no known workarounds for this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
dolphin-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
libnextcloudsync0 - 3.7.0-2
nautilus-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
nemo-nextcloud - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-cmd - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-common - 3.7.0-2
nextcloud-desktop-l10n - 3.7.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nextcloud-desktop package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.0-2').
